messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On April 14, DET. I. J. Dalton was dispatched to investigate a disturbance at Sterling Concert Hall. Key informants were Ms. Rivera, the event manager, and Mr. Lawson, a stage technician. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. K. L. Ross - OPERATIONS Det. Dalton, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective M. N. Ortiz and Detective O. P. Quinn joined the investigation. ELLIS 15:30 Disturbance Ms. Rivera reported a confrontation between two bands, and Mr. Lawson described damage to stage equipment. Audio. Technician Quinn Jr. collected sound recordings of the incident. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Dalton Jr, Det. Ortiz, Det. Quinn OPERATIONS Lt. Ross INFORMANT Lawson, George 88 Pine Avenue, Sterling, Nevada 168-645. 93260. ELLIS 15:30 Disturbance By 5:10 PM, Detectives Dalton, Ortiz, and Quinn, guided by Lieutenant Ross, took statements from band members. Captain Q. R. Stewart recommended additional security for future events. Sergeant S. T. Phillips and Sergeant U. V. Wilson reviewed backstage access logs. By 6:40 PM, peace was restored, but investigations into the damage continued. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Dalton Jr, Det. Ortiz, Det. Quinn OPERATIONS Lt. Ross AFFIDAVIT - Disturbance Report 1) Event Schedule 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Damage Reports 5) Backstage CCTV (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE H. Taylor S.C.H.P.D. 21.60 P52 2378 Rivera, ANA NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 135-2670 DETECTIVE: I. DALTON ITEM: 52-5000- 98 CRIME: 15:30 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 82885 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 10/20/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. I. J. Dalton  Officer Context: On April 14, DET. I. J. Dalton was dispatched to investigate a disturbance at Sterling Concert Hall. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. K. L. Ross  Officer Context: Lt. K. L. Ross - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective M. N. Ortiz  Officer Context: Detective M. N. Ortiz and Detective O. P. Quinn joined the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective O. P. Quinn  Officer Context: Detective M. N. Ortiz and Detective O. P. Quinn joined the investigation. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Quinn Jr.  Officer Context: Audio. Technician Quinn Jr. collected sound recordings of the incident. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Dalton  Officer Context: By 5:10 PM, Detectives Dalton, Ortiz, and Quinn, guided by Lieutenant Ross, took statements from band members. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Ortiz  Officer Context: By 5:10 PM, Detectives Dalton, Ortiz, and Quinn, guided by Lieutenant Ross, took statements from band members. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Quinn  Officer Context: By 5:10 PM, Detectives Dalton, Ortiz, and Quinn, guided by Lieutenant Ross, took statements from band members. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain Q. R. Stewart  Officer Context: Captain Q. R. Stewart recommended additional security for future events. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant S. T. Phillips  Officer Context: Sergeant S. T. Phillips and Sergeant U. V. Wilson reviewed backstage access logs. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant U. V. Wilson Officer Context: Sergeant S. T. Phillips and Sergeant U. V. Wilson reviewed backstage access logs. Officer Role: Sergeant
